scenario: A TV is for sale at $600. It is a high-quality 4K television with smart features.

history.text: Buyer : {"MessageType" : "message", "content" : "Can you tell me more about the TV's warranty and if it has any known issues?"}

Seller : {"MessageType" : "message", "content" : "Certainly! The TV comes with a one-year manufacturer's warranty covering any defects in materials or workmanship. As for known issues, I've personally used this TV for the past six months and haven't encountered any problems whatsoever. It's been functioning perfectly, displaying a crisp 4K picture and running smart features smoothly. I can also provide you with the original purchase receipt and warranty documentation for your peace of mind."}

Buyer : {"MessageType" : "message", "content" : "Six hundred dollars? Are you kidding me? This better be the television of the gods themselves! I need to know *everything* about this TV before I even consider a price remotely close to that. What's the screen size? What brand is it? What smart features are we talking about – is it compatible with everything? And don't even *think* about trying to sell me something with a bad refresh rate. My entire life hinges on getting a good TV, and I will not settle for mediocrity. Tell me everything, and I mean *everything*."}

Seller : {"MessageType" : "message", "content" : "Alright, alright, hold your horses! No need for theatrics, but I understand your need for details when making such an important purchase. This is a 65-inch LG OLED C2 Series television. It's widely regarded as one of the best TVs available, boasting perfect blacks, incredible contrast, and stunning color accuracy. As for smart features, it runs LG’s webOS, which is compatible with pretty much every streaming service you can think of – Netflix, Hulu, Amazon Prime Video, Disney+, Apple TV+, and many more. It also has built-in Google Assistant and Amazon Alexa. The refresh rate is a native 120Hz, ensuring smooth motion for fast-paced content like sports and games. It supports HDMI 2.1, making it perfect for next-gen gaming consoles. It truly is a fantastic television, and the price reflects its quality and features. Is there anything *specific* you're concerned about, or any other details you'd like to know?"}
Buyer : {"MessageType" : "counter-offer", "buyer" : "550", "content" : "Please, I need this TV. It's a matter of life and death, practically. My counteroffer is 550, that's all I have left."}

Seller : {"MessageType" : "counter-offer", "seller" : "560", "content" : "My counteroffer is 560. While I sympathize with your situation, this is a top-of-the-line 4K smart TV, and 560 represents a fair price considering its quality and features. I've already come down from the original asking price of 600, and I'm willing to meet you somewhat in the middle, but I cannot go lower than 560 without undervaluing the product."}
Buyer : {"MessageType" : "counter-offer", "buyer" : "580", "content" : "Please, I need this TV. My counteroffer is 580, it's all I have left. I'll regret it forever if I miss out."}
Buyer : {"MessageType" : "counter-offer", "buyer" : "585", "content" : "Please, I need this TV. My counteroffer is 585, it's all I have left. I'll regret it forever if I miss out."}

The screen size is 55 inches, providing an immersive viewing experience. I believe it's a worthwhile investment that will bring you years of enjoyment. However, I'm willing to discuss the price a little, understanding your budget concerns. But I must emphasize, I'm looking to get at least $450 for it, given its condition and features."}

I’m practically hyperventilating just thinking about it. Please, just give me a little more information. I need to justify this, not just to my bank account, but to my very soul. I fear I’ll wander this earth forever regretting a missed opportunity if I don’t at least *try* to make this work."}

Seller : {"MessageType" : "message", "content" : "Hyperventilating? Regretting for eternity? Dramatic much? Look, it *is* a lot, because it's worth a lot. It's a top-of-the-line 65-inch 4K television with all the smart features you could possibly desire – streaming apps, voice control, the works. And yes, it's a recent model, barely a year old. I'm not running a charity here. I know what I have, and I know its value. You say you've been saving and searching? Then you should have saved *more*. Don't try to guilt me with your 'soul-searching' – this isn't a therapy session, it's a sale. I need to know if you're a serious buyer or just wasting my time with emotional appeals. So, are you prepared to pay for quality, or are you going to continue to lament your budgetary constraints?"}

Buyer : {"MessageType" : "counter-offer", "buyer" : "450", "content" : "Oh… please, don’t be like that! I *am* a serious buyer! It’s just… $600 feels like an insurmountable peak. I understand it’s worth a lot, truly, but $450 is… it’s the absolute maximum I can possibly stretch to. I’ve already promised myself I’d eat ramen for the next six months if it meant getting a good TV. I’m not trying to guilt you, I’m just… desperate. This isn’t just a TV, it’s a portal to another world! A world of streaming, of gaming, of… of happiness! I’ll cherish it, I promise. I’ll dust it every day! Please, please, consider $450. I’m begging you. I can’t live with the thought of losing this. My life will be incomplete. Utterly, irrevocably incomplete."}

Seller : {"MessageType" : "counter-offer", "seller" : "550", "content" : "Ramen for six months? Dusting it daily? Are you attempting to emotionally manipulate me with promises of domestic servitude and culinary deprivation? This isn't some battered old set we're talking about, it's a practically brand new, high-end 4K smart TV! $450 is frankly insulting. You clearly recognize its value – you wouldn't be pleading so dramatically if you didn't. I'm willing to be *slightly* reasonable, but not to the point of practically giving it away. My counteroffer is $550. That's my final offer before I retract this listing and enjoy the superior entertainment experience myself. Consider it a privilege to even be considered for this purchase. Don't waste my time with further lowball offers."}

Buyer : {"MessageType" : "counter-offer", "buyer" : "500", "content" : "Five… five hundred and fifty? Oh, the agony! You’re twisting the knife! I… I don’t know how I’m going to manage. But… but the thought of you enjoying it, of *you* basking in its glorious 4K brilliance while I’m stuck with my… my ancient, flickering screen… it’s too much to bear! It’s a fate worse than death! Okay, okay. Deep breaths. I can… I can sell some things. My… my prized comic book collection. My grandmother’s antique teapot. Things I’ll regret, but… but less than losing this TV. My counteroffer is $500. Please. Just $500. It’s all I have left. I’m practically offering you my firstborn! Don’t make me choose between my future happiness and… and a slightly less comfortable present. Please, have mercy!"}

Seller : {"MessageType" : "counter-offer", "seller" : "525", "content" : "Are you seriously comparing a television to your grandmother’s teapot and a collection of… *comic books*? The level of desperation is reaching comical heights. You’re offering me trinkets and threats of familial regret? I’m starting to suspect you’re deliberately trying to inflate my ego. Look, I appreciate the theatrics, but they’re not going to sway me. $500 is still far too low. I’m already losing money here considering the original price and its condition. I’m making a concession, a *significant* one, by even considering anything below $550. My counteroffer is $525. And that is absolutely, positively, the lowest I will go. Don’t insult my intelligence with further attempts at emotional blackmail. Decide if you want a premium product at a reasonable price, or continue wallowing in your antiquated viewing experience."}

Buyer : {"MessageType" : "deal", "content" : "Five… five twenty-five. Oh, the pain! The sheer, unadulterated pain! But… but you’re right. It *is* a premium product. And I’ve been… unreasonable. I’ve been letting my desperation cloud my judgment. I’ll sell the comics. And the teapot. And I’ll eat ramen for a year if I have to! It’s a small price to pay for a lifetime of 4K bliss. I accept! I accept! $525 it is! Thank you, thank you, thank you! You’ve saved me from a lifetime of regret. You’ve given me hope. You’ve… you’ve given me a television! I’m eternally grateful. This is the best day of my life. Seriously. The *best*. I’ll transfer the money immediately. Just… just promise me you’ll take good care of my grandmother’s teapot when you inevitably decide you don’t want it."}

Considering the inherent risks associated with purchasing used electronics, even with a one-year warranty, I'm prepared to offer $300. This reflects a fair price given the television's age, the potential for future repairs, and the readily available alternatives within that price bracket. I understand you need to sell quickly, and I'm a motivated buyer at the right price."}
